code: @Manual{,   title = {dmft: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)},   author = {Ahmad Sofi-Mahmudi},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/choxos/dmft}, }

what: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: dmft implements GBD-style Bayesian hierarchical models estimating projecting dental caries burden (DMFT/dmft indices) subnational level country.

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: Bayesian spatial-temporal-age modeling BYM2 spatial effects, RW2 temporal trends, RW1 age effects Two inference backends: INLA (fast approximate Bayesian) Stan (full MCMC via cmdstanr) Gaussian meta-regression inverse-variance weighting study-level summary data Projection framework reference, optimistic, pessimistic scenarios Publication-ready visualizations: choropleth maps, temporal trends, uncertainty ribbons Country-agnostic: works shapefile study-level data

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
code: # Install from GitHub pak::pak("choxos/dmft")  # Or with remotes remotes::install_github("choxos/dmft")

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: INLA backend (default) requires INLA package: Stan backend requires cmdstanr:
code: install.packages("INLA",   repos = c(CRAN = "https://cloud.r-project.org",             INLA = "https://inla.r-inla-download.org/R/stable")) install.packages("cmdstanr",   repos = c("https://stan-dev.r-universe.dev",             "https://cloud.r-project.org")) cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
code: library(dmft)  # 1. Configure the analysis for your country cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C", "Region_D"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   projection_range = c(2021, 2030) )  # 2. Run the full pipeline results <- dmft_run(   data_path = "my_data.csv",   shapefile_path = "my_regions.shp",   config = cfg )  # 3. Visualize dmft_plot_map(results$estimates$permanent, results$adjacency$sf, year = 2020) dmft_plot_trends(results$estimates$permanent, results$projections$permanent)

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
code: # Load and clean data raw <- dmft_load("data.csv", config = cfg) clean <- dmft_clean(raw, config = cfg)  # Create spatial structure adj <- dmft_adjacency(shapefile_path = "regions.shp", config = cfg)  # Fit model fit <- dmft_fit(clean$permanent, adj, dentition = "permanent", config = cfg)  # Predict and diagnose estimates <- dmft_predict(fit, config = cfg) diagnostics <- dmft_diagnose(fit, config = cfg)  # Project future trends projections <- dmft_project(fit, estimates, config = cfg)

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: input CSV/XLSX contain study-level summary statistics minimum:

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)
text: package fits Bayesian hierarchical model:
code: y_i ~ Normal(mu_i, se_i^2)    [Gaussian meta-regression]  mu_i = beta_0 + S_region + T_year + A_age + G_sex + interactions  S ~ BYM2(rho, sigma_spatial)   [spatial: ICAR + IID mixture] T ~ RW2(sigma_temporal)        [temporal: second-order random walk] A ~ RW1(sigma_age)             [age: first-order random walk] G ~ IID(sigma_sex)             [sex: exchangeable]

title: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft)

what: Compute BYM2 scaling factor from ICAR precision matrix — compute_bym2_scaling_factor
title: Compute BYM2 scaling factor from ICAR precision matrix — compute_bym2_scaling_factor
text: scaling factor geometric mean non-zero eigenvalues ICAR precision matrix Q (Riebler et al. 2016). ensures proper variance interpretation BYM2 spatial random effect.

what: dmft: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft) — dmft-package
title: dmft: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft) — dmft-package
text: Implements GBD-style Bayesian hierarchical models estimating projecting dental caries burden (DMFT/dmft indices) subnational level. Combines BYM2 spatial random effects, RW2 temporal trends, RW1 age effects Gaussian meta-regression. Supports country given study-level data regional shapefile. Provides complete pipeline data cleaning model fitting, diagnostics, projections, publication-ready visualizations. Two inference backends supported: INLA (fast approximate Bayesian) Stan (full MCMC).

title: dmft: Bayesian Hierarchical Modeling of Dental Caries (DMFT/dmft) — dmft-package
text: Maintainer: Ahmad Sofi-Mahmudi ahmad.sofimahmudi@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder]

what: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
text: Builds neighbourhood graph needed BYM2 spatial random effects. Uses Queen contiguity (shared boundary vertex). Isolated regions (islands) connected nearest neighbour.

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
code: dmft_adjacency(   shapefile_path = NULL,   sf_obj = NULL,   region_name_col = NULL,   config )

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
text: shapefile_path Path shapefile (.shp). sf_obj Alternatively, sf object already memory. Exactly one shapefile_path sf_obj must provided. region_name_col Column shapefile containing region names. NULL, function tries detect automatically. config dmft_config object. Region ordering adjacency matrix match config$regions.

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency
text: list elements: adj_matrix Binary adjacency matrix (n x n). nb spdep neighbourhood object. sf sf object (reordered match config). graph_path Path INLA graph file (temp file). node1, node2 Edge list Stan / BYM2 scaling.

title: Create spatial adjacency structure from a shapefile — dmft_adjacency

what: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
text: Performs column standardization, region name mapping, sex standardization, age group assignment, outlier flagging, value validation. Returns separate deciduous permanent datasets ready modeling.

title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
text: data data frame dmft_load(). config dmft_config object.

title: Clean and standardize DMFT data — dmft_clean
text: list elements deciduous permanent, tibble standardized columns imputed uncertainty.

what: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
text: Defines parameters DMFT/dmft analysis: regions, time period, age groups, model priors, projection settings.

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
code: dmft_config(   regions,   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(1990, 2025),   projection_range = NULL,   age_groups_deciduous = c("0-4", "5-9", "10-14"),   age_groups_permanent = c("5-9", "10-14", "15-19", "20-24", "25-29", "30-34", "35-39",     "40-44", "45-49", "50-54", "55-59", "60+"),   dmft_max_deciduous = 20L,   dmft_max_permanent = 28L,   cv_default = 0.3,   backend = c("inla", "cmdstanr"),   seed = 12345L,   n_draws = 250L,   n_cores = max(1L, parallel::detectCores() - 1L),   region_mapping = NULL,   stan_settings = list(chains = 4, parallel_chains = 4, iter_warmup = 1000, iter_sampling     = 1000, adapt_delta = 0.95, max_treedepth = 12) )

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
text: regions Character vector region names (e.g., provinces). region_col Column name data containing region names. year_range Length-2 integer vector c(start, end) historical period. projection_range Optional length-2 vector c(start, end) projections. NULL, projections configured. age_groups_deciduous Character vector deciduous age group labels. age_groups_permanent Character vector permanent age group labels. dmft_max_deciduous Maximum biologically plausible dmft (default 20). dmft_max_permanent Maximum biologically plausible DMFT (default 28). cv_default Default coefficient variation uncertainty imputation. backend Inference backend: "inla" "cmdstanr". seed Random seed reproducibility. n_draws Number posterior draws. n_cores Number CPU cores. region_mapping Optional named list mapping alternative region names canonical names regions. stan_settings Named list Stan MCMC settings. used backend = "cmdstanr".

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
text: object class "dmft_config".

title: Create a DMFT analysis configuration — dmft_config
code: cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020) ) cfg #> ℹ DMFT analysis configuration #>   Regions:      3 (Region_A, Region_B, Region_C, ...) #>   Historical:   2000-2020 (21 years) #>   Age groups:   deciduous=3, permanent=12 #>   Backend:      inla #>   Seed:         12345

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
text: Computes fit statistics (DIC, WAIC), residual diagnostics (RMSE, MAE), spatial autocorrelation residuals (Moran's ), prediction validity checks.

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit(). config dmft_config object.

title: Run model diagnostics — dmft_diagnose
text: list elements: fit_stats, residuals, spatial, validity.

what: Fit a Bayesian hierarchical model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
title: Fit a Bayesian hierarchical model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
text: Implements GBD-style spatial-temporal-age model BYM2 spatial random effects, RW2 temporal trends, RW1 age effects, IID sex effects. Uses Gaussian meta-regression (identity link) default.

title: Fit a Bayesian hierarchical model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
code: dmft_fit(   data,   adjacency,   dentition = c("deciduous", "permanent"),   config,   family = "gaussian",   include_interactions = TRUE )

title: Fit a Bayesian hierarchical model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
text: data data frame (one dentition subsets dmft_clean()). adjacency Adjacency object dmft_adjacency(). dentition "deciduous" "permanent". config dmft_config object. family Likelihood family: "gaussian" (default, meta-regression) "nbinomial". include_interactions Logical; include space-time, space-age, time-age IID interaction random effects.

title: Fit a Bayesian hierarchical model for DMFT/dmft — dmft_fit
text: fitted model object (INLA wrapped cmdstanr fit).

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
text: Reads CSV Excel file containing study-level DMFT/dmft data. file minimum: region column, year, age_start, age_end, least one mean_dmft mean_DMFT.

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
text: file_path Path CSV XLSX file. config dmft_config object (used identify region column).

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
text: tibble raw data.

title: Load DMFT study-level data — dmft_load
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cfg <- dmft_config(regions = c("A", "B"), region_col = "province",                    year_range = c(2000, 2020)) dat <- dmft_load("my_data.csv", config = cfg) } # }

what: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
text: Creates realistic test data following known age--region patterns, useful validating analysis pipeline using real data.

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
code: dmft_phantom(   config,   dentition = c("both", "deciduous", "permanent"),   n_per_cell = 1L,   temporal_trend = -0.015,   missing_prob = 0.15 )

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
text: config dmft_config object. dentition "deciduous", "permanent", "". n_per_cell Number synthetic studies per region-year-age cell. temporal_trend Annual proportional change (negative = improvement). missing_prob Probability cell missing (sparse data).

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
text: tibble synthetic study-level data.

title: Generate synthetic (phantom) DMFT data for testing — dmft_phantom
code: cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("A", "B", "C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020) ) phantom <- dmft_phantom(cfg, dentition = "permanent") #> ✔ Generated 645 phantom records head(phantom) #>                  study province year age_start age_end    sex   n mean_DMFT #> 1   phantom_A_2000_5-9        A 2000         5       9 Female 142      0.80 #> 2 phantom_A_2000_15-19        A 2000        15      19   Both 152      4.57 #> 3 phantom_A_2000_20-24        A 2000        20      24 Female 335      7.21 #> 4 phantom_A_2000_25-29        A 2000        25      29 Female 308      6.80 #> 5 phantom_A_2000_30-34        A 2000        30      34   Both  65      8.66 #> 6 phantom_A_2000_35-39        A 2000        35      39   Both 410     11.54 #>   sd_DMFT #> 1    0.64 #> 2    1.71 #> 3    2.91 #> 4    3.48 #> 5    3.59 #> 6    4.55

text: estimates Predictions dmft_predict(). sf_obj sf object region boundaries. year Year display (estimates averaged across age groups). region_name_col Column sf_obj matching estimates$region. value_col Column map (default "predicted"). title Optional plot title.

what: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model — dmft_predict
title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model — dmft_predict
text: Produces predictions region-year-age combinations historical period. Uses posterior sampling available, falling back delta-method approximation.

title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model — dmft_predict
Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model — dmft_predict
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit(). config dmft_config object. n_posterior Number posterior samples uncertainty. Set 0 use delta method.

title: Generate predictions from a fitted DMFT model — dmft_predict
text: tibble columns: region, year, age_group, predicted, lower, upper.

what: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
text: Extracts temporal trend fitted model generates three scenarios (reference, optimistic, pessimistic) using damped RW2 extrapolation bounded uncertainty growth.

title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
text: fit fitted model dmft_fit(). estimates Predictions dmft_predict(). config dmft_config object. Must projection_start projection_end set. damping_factor Trend damping per year (default 0.95).

title: Project DMFT trends into the future — dmft_project
text: tibble columns: year, scenario, mean_proj, lower, upper.

what: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
text: Orchestrates complete workflow: data loading, cleaning, spatial structure, model fitting, prediction, diagnostics, optional projections.

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
code: dmft_run(   data_path,   shapefile_path,   config,   dentition = c("both", "deciduous", "permanent"),   region_name_col = NULL,   skip_projections = FALSE )

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
text: data_path Path study-level CSV/XLSX data. shapefile_path Path regional shapefile. config dmft_config object. dentition dentition(s) model: "", "deciduous", "permanent". region_name_col Column shapefile containing region names. skip_projections Skip projection step.

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
text: list elements config, clean_data, adjacency, fits, estimates, diagnostics, optionally projections.

title: Run the full DMFT analysis pipeline — dmft_run
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ cfg <- dmft_config(   regions = c("Region_A", "Region_B", "Region_C"),   region_col = "province",   year_range = c(2000, 2020),   projection_range = c(2021, 2030) ) results <- dmft_run("data.csv", "regions.shp", config = cfg) } # }

text: data data frame. mean_col Name mean column. sd_col Name SD column (NULL). se_col Name SE column (NULL). n_col Name sample-size column (default "n"). lci_col Name lower CI column (NULL). uci_col Name upper CI column (NULL). cv_default Default coefficient variation SD missing.
